metadata.title: CVE-2020-20448 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
FFmpeg 4.1.3 is affected by a Divide By Zero issue vialibavcodec/ratecontrol.c, which allows a remote malicious user to cause aDenial of Service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-20448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 3.4.7
libav-tools - 3.4.7
libavcodec-extra - 3.4.7
libavcodec-extra57 - 3.4.7
libavcodec57 - 3.4.7
libavdevice57 - 3.4.7
libavfilter-extra - 3.4.7
libavfilter-extra6 - 3.4.7
libavfilter6 - 3.4.7
libavformat57 - 3.4.7
libavresample3 - 3.4.7
libavutil55 - 3.4.7
libpostproc54 - 3.4.7
libswresample2 - 3.4.7
libswscale4 - 3.4.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.7').
